text:
.H/O chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD, Bronchitis,
   Emphysema) with Acute Exacerbation
   Assessment:
   Patient on 5 L NC in am sating 90-100%.  O2 sats down to low 80
s a few
   times throughout day.  Lungs sound rhonchorous in upper airways and
   dimished at bases. Patient unable to cough up own secretions.
   Action:
   -          NT suctioned frequently for dry thick yellow mucus.
   -          Put on aerosol mask throughout day
   -          Nebs- mucomyst around the clock.
   -          Patient encouraged to cough and deep breath frequently,
   chest PT.
   -          OOB to chair.
   -          Blood gas drawn.
   Response:
   Weaned to face tent at 40%.  Sating 93-97%.
   7.31, O2-  76 PCo2- 62
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor, NT suction as necessary, encourage to Cough and
   Deep breath.
   Impaired Skin Integrity
   Assessment:
   Patient has multiple old skin tears and an old incision site on Lower
   left back which is reddened and boggy.  Pressure ulcer in left groin
   area.
   Action:
   Dr. [**Last Name (STitle) 3552**] in to assess old reddened incision site, site left open to
   air for healing, cleaned.
   Turned and repositioned frequently.
   Response:
   Dr. [**Last Name (STitle) 3552**] was in touch with primary team.
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor, consult with wound care.
   Pain control (acute pain, chronic pain)
   Assessment:
   Patient complaining of [**4-17**] out of 10 pain throughout day.  Having some
   pain in back but also complaining of constant pain in LUQ of abdomen.
   Action:
   Continues on Dilaudid pca, oxycodone, and gabapentin for pain relief.
   Around the clock Tylenol added to pain regime.
   Turned and repositioned for comfort.
   Encouraged to use PCA.
   Dr. [**Last Name (STitle) 3552**] in to assess LUQ abdominal pain.
   Response:
   Patient consistently has at least 4 out of 10 pain.
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor

info.concept: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease of horses
